Speed Test Chip Performance

Contents

  • 1. What is Nitrox Chip Performance?
  • 2. What is CAVIUM_SPEED identifier and why it is used?
  • 3. When is CAVIUM_SPEED identifier used?
  • 4. What is the result of Chip-performance test?
  • 5. What is the default value of Test-time and what is done by test in that case?
  • 6. How to change the default values of Test-time (ie. speed_timeout)?
  • 7. Is there any changes, if more than one devices are present?
  • 8. How to get the performace number for a particular SSL/IPSec API?
  • 9. Can I use CAVIUM_SPEED identifier in place of CAVIUM_BLOCKING?

1. What is Nitrox Chip Performance?

It is used for measuring Nitrox chip performance in blocking mode. For measuring the chip performance of Nitrox, request type should be set to CAVIUM_SPEED in the user level APIs. This tells the Nitrox driver to perform blocking speedtest and can be measured maximum performance of the Nitrox hardware.

2. What is CAVIUM_SPEED identifier and why it is used?

CAVIUM_SPEED identifier is a request type for blocking chip-performance. It is used in APIs only in case of Chip-performace for measuring the performance of Nitrox Chip.

3. When is CAVIUM_SPEED identifier used?

CAVIUM_SPEED identifier is used only in measuring the Chip performance of the Nitrox processor.

4. What is the result of Chip-performance test?

Chip-performace test retrun the result in output buffer of API, in form of Speed_Test_Info structure defined in cavium/software/include/cavium_common.h Result contains number of completed requests, input data length, output data length and time taken to complete those requests.

5. What is the default value of Test-time and what is done by test in that case?

Default value of Test-time is 0 second. In this case, tests the performance of Nitrox Chip for fully loaded command queue.

6. How to change the default values of Test-time (ie. speed_timeout)?

Test-time value can be set by the speed_timeout proc entry in /proc/cavium/speed_timeout.

For example: If you want to run the test for 10 seconds then set the speed_timeout proc entry as

bash# echo 10 >/proc/cavium/speed_timeout

7. Is there any changes, if more than one devices are present?

Yes. If more than one devices are present and CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API flag is on, then by default Speedtest measure the performance of Nitrox Chip according to number of Nitrox devices present on the PCI bus.

For example: If 2 devices are present and CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API flag is on, then Speedtest measure the performance of Nitrox Chips for 2 fully loaded command queue.

8. How to get the performace number for a particular SSL/IPSec API?

To get the performace number for a API, called that API using CAVIUM_SPEED request type. Then performance test return the result in output buffer.

9. Can I use CAVIUM_SPEED identifier in place of CAVIUM_BLOCKING?

No. If you want to call an API in blocking mode use CAVIUM_BLOCKING in the real time ssl application. CAVIUM_SPEED identifier is used only for measuring the maximum throughput by the Nitrox Processor.
